labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Yunxiao DevOps Server" is primarily focused on enabling AI assistants to manage development workflows, enhancing collaboration between developers through automation. The core functionality revolves around code management, project and pipeline automation, package handling, and organizational collaboration. The available tools clearly target repository management, change request tracking, project tracking, and CI/CD pipeline operations, with strong emphasis on development automation. The server enables teams to reduce repetitive tasks by automating core workflows, allowing developers to focus on innovation and delivery.
labels.reasoning: The primary focus of the server on code management, project management, and pipeline automation firmly places it in the "Development Tools" category. The secondary labels "CI/CD" and "Collaboration Tools" are included to highlight its specific technical capabilities and team-oriented features. A custom label was not deemed necessary as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Yunxiao DevOps Server
server_info_crawled.author: @yjiace/alibabacloud-devops-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI assistants to interact seamlessly with the Yunxiao platform for enhanced development collaboration. Automate code repository management, code reviews, project and pipeline management, and package handling to optimize workflows and boost team productivity. Reduce repetitive tasks and focus on innovation and product delivery.

tools.name: generate_pipeline_yaml
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Generate only the YAML configuration for a pipeline without creating it. **üìã Use Cases:** - Preview YAML before creating pipeline - Generate YAML for manual deployment - Debug pipeline configuration **üìñ Recommended Workflow:** 1. üéØ Parse user description for explicit parameters 2. üîç If missing context, prefer IDE detection (terminal + file reading) over API calls 3. üöÄ Call this tool with collected parameters **üí° Parameter Collection Strategy:** - For QUICK pipeline creation: Use IDE detection (git config, file reading) - For PRECISE parameter selection: Consider list_repositories, list_service_connections when needed - Balance efficiency vs. accuracy based on user intent **‚ö° Built-in capabilities:** Handles default service connections internally, auto-extracts project name from repo URL

tools.name: create_pipeline_from_description
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Create a pipeline using structured parameters extracted from user descriptions and environment context. **üîß Built-in Capabilities:** - ‚úÖ Automatically retrieves default service connection IDs when not specified - ‚úÖ Handles repository and service connection logic internally - ‚úÖ Auto-extracts project name from repository URL (git@host:org/repo.git ‚Üí repo) - ‚úÖ Supports both IDE detection and explicit parameter specification **üìñ Recommended Workflow:** 1. üéØ PARSE user description for explicit parameters 2. üîç DETECT missing info from IDE environment FIRST: - Run `git config --get remote.origin.url` ‚Üí repoUrl - Run `git branch --show-current` ‚Üí branch - Auto-extract serviceName from repoUrl - Check project files for tech stack: * pom.xml ‚Üí buildLanguage='java', buildTool='maven' * build.gradle ‚Üí buildLanguage='java', buildTool='gradle' * package.json + package-lock.json ‚Üí buildLanguage='nodejs', buildTool='npm' * package.json + yarn.lock ‚Üí buildLanguage='nodejs', buildTool='yarn' * requirements.txt ‚Üí buildLanguage='python', buildTool='pip' * go.mod ‚Üí buildLanguage='go', buildTool='go' * *.csproj ‚Üí buildLanguage='dotnet', buildTool='dotnet' 3. üöÄ CALL this tool with collected parameters **‚ö†Ô∏è Important Guidelines:** - DO NOT call list_repositories unless user explicitly asks to choose from available repositories - DO NOT call list_service_connections unless user explicitly asks to choose from available connections - ALWAYS try IDE detection first before making any API calls - If IDE detection fails, THEN consider API calls as fallback **üéØ Parameter Priority:** 1. üë§ USER EXPLICIT (highest) - buildLanguage, buildTool, versions, deployTarget 2. üîç IDE DETECTION (preferred) - repoUrl, branch, serviceName, tech stack 3. ü§ñ TOOL DEFAULTS (automatic) - serviceConnectionId, organizationId **üîç IDE Detection Rules (MUST TRY FIRST):** - üìÇ Repository: `git config --get remote.origin.url` ‚Üí repoUrl - üåø Branch: `git branch --show-current` ‚Üí branch - üè∑Ô∏è Service Name: Auto-extracted from repoUrl (git@host:org/repo.git ‚Üí repo) - ‚òï Java Maven: pom.xml exists ‚Üí buildLanguage='java', buildTool='maven' - üèóÔ∏è Java Gradle: build.gradle exists ‚Üí buildLanguage='java', buildTool='gradle' - üü¢ Node npm: package.json + package-lock.json ‚Üí buildLanguage='nodejs', buildTool='npm' - üß∂ Node yarn: package.json + yarn.lock ‚Üí buildLanguage='nodejs', buildTool='yarn' - üêç Python: requirements.txt ‚Üí buildLanguage='python', buildTool='pip' - üêπ Go: go.mod ‚Üí buildLanguage='go', buildTool='go' - üíô .NET: *.csproj ‚Üí buildLanguage='dotnet', buildTool='dotnet' **üìù Version Detection (from project files):** - ‚òï JDK: Read pom.xml <maven.compiler.source> ‚Üí jdkVersion - üü¢ Node: Read package.json engines.node ‚Üí nodeVersion - üêç Python: Read .python-version, pyproject.toml ‚Üí pythonVersion - üêπ Go: Read go.mod go directive ‚Üí goVersion **üéØ Deployment Parsing:** - 'ÈÉ®ÁΩ≤Âà∞‰∏ªÊú∫/VM/ËôöÊãüÊú∫' ‚Üí deployTarget='vm' - 'ÈÉ®ÁΩ≤Âà∞Kubernetes/K8s' ‚Üí deployTarget='k8s' - 'Âè™ÊûÑÂª∫/ÊûÑÂª∫Âà∂ÂìÅ' ‚Üí deployTarget='none' **üîó Service Connection Strategy (3 scenarios):** 1. **User specifies ID explicitly** (e.g., '‰ΩøÁî®ÊúçÂä°ËøûÊé•ID abc123') ‚Üí ‚úÖ Pass serviceConnectionId=abc123 directly, NO list_service_connections call needed 2. **User doesn't specify any ID** (most common case) ‚Üí ‚úÖ Pass serviceConnectionId=null, tool will auto-retrieve default ID internally 3. **User wants to choose from available options** (e.g., 'ÊòæÁ§∫ÂèØÁî®ÁöÑÊúçÂä°ËøûÊé•ËÆ©ÊàëÈÄâÊã©') ‚Üí üîç Call list_service_connections first, then let user choose, then create pipeline **ü§î When to Use Other Tools:** - User asks to "select from available repositories" ‚Üí use list_repositories first - User wants to "choose from service connections" ‚Üí use list_service_connections first - User wants to see options before deciding ‚Üí gather info first, then create - For quick creation with current repo ‚Üí directly use IDE detection **‚úÖ Required:** organizationId, name, buildLanguage, buildTool

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@yjiace/alibabacloud-devops-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: yunxiaoAccessToken
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Alibaba Cloud Yunxiao personal access token
